page.title: 01Bilsington! Hill & Marshland
page.content: Most of the area is part of the Rommney Marsh criss-crossed by drainage dykes and is intensively farmed. Mixed arable & the local 'Rommney' sheep dominate with some areas on the marshes, several square kilometres are not crossed by road or footpath. However the track of the CEGB pylons carrying power from Dungerness is a stark contrast. At the edge of the marsh is the old canal used by anglers extensively as it is well stocked and, unlike the dykes, is never drained. North of the canal the land rises steeply and although mostly unmanned grazing land some woodland is found which stretches into larger areas in adjacent grids. The only major town, Bisilington offers little but peace, quiet and quaintness. Looking south from the Bilsington Road you can see to Dungeness & appreciate
